alert.note: Alert for Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 6:57PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Dona Ana and northwestern El Paso Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 655 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorm outflow about 3 miles west of the NWS Santa Teresa office, moving east around 25 mph. HAZARD...Gusty winds of 25 to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Blowing dust could reduce visibilities to less than 3 miles. Locations impacted include... West El Paso, Central El Paso, Santa Teresa, Anthony, Vado, Sunland Park, Anthony Gap, Canutillo, Berino, Westway, Vinton, Chamberino, La Union, La Mesa, Union Pacific Intermodal Terminal and Franklin Mountains State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 157 and 164. Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin
